newsitem.title: GERMANY: BMW sees lower 96 losses at Rover.
newsitem.headline: BMW sees lower 96 losses at Rover.

text.p: German car maker BMW said on Friday that it expected 1996 pre-tax losses at its U.K. unit Rover to be below 1995 levels.
In response to a Reuter enquiry, a BMW spokesman confirmed that the pre-tax losses at Rover would be lower this year, but he declined to give a specific figure.
German weekly newsmagazine Manager Magazin said the loss would be around 270 million marks ($173.2 million) this year after standing at 335 million marks last year.
The spokesman also said Rover's investments, running around at nine percent of total sales, were currently outpacing parent group investments, running at between seven and eight percent.
Rover is financing half of the investments from its cash flow. The other half is funded through loans from banks and BMW. Rover pays interest on these loans, the spokesman said.

In 1995 Rover's investments stood around 1.2 billion marks, and BMW management board chairman Bern Pischetsrieder had earlier in the year said investments would stay around these levels in the coming year.
